thread.title: At last, West Jefferson hospital lease deal could close next week
thread.title_full: At last, West Jefferson hospital lease deal could close next week | NOLA.com

author: Diana Samuels, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: At last, West Jefferson hospital lease deal could close next week
text:
After a three-year effort to lease West Jefferson Medical Center to a private operator, Jefferson Parish is on the cusp of closing the deal with LCMC Health. A public hearing held by the Louisiana attorney general's office is scheduled Monday (Sept. 28) at 1 p.m., and assuming all goes smoothly, deputy parish attorney Ed Rapier said the lease deal could be finalized in a day or two.
The hearing is the last step that the attorney general's office needs to take before it approves -- or disapproves -- the lease. Without that approval, the parish can't move forward.
"The AG's office could give us a letter of approval at the end of the meeting, or take a day or two to decide," Rapier said. Parish officials hope to close the deal Tuesday or Wednesday, "immediately upon receiving the AG's approval," he said.
There's a reason the parish wants to move quickly. LCMC, a non-profit hospital operator, has the right to withdraw if the deal hasn't closed by Wednesday.
The 45-year-lease was pegged at $565 million in cash and capital investment. But LCMC lowered its offer by $25 million in August, as the hospital's value dropped .
Monday's hearing is to be held at the West Jefferson Medical Center's auditorium. The address is 1101 Medical Center Blvd. in Marrero.
